title: Introduction to Quadratic Functions
description: Discover the fundamentals of quadratic functions, their characteristics, and how they model real-world parabolic relationships.
subject: Mathematics
achievementDescription: Understand the basic structure and behavior of quadratic functions

text.introduction: Quadratic functions are polynomial functions of degree 2, with the general form f(x) = ax² + bx + c. Unlike linear functions that create straight lines, quadratic functions create parabolas - curved shapes that appear everywhere in nature and technology, from the path of thrown objects to the design of satellite dishes.

sections.title: Understanding Quadratic Functions
sections.content:
**General Form:** f(x) = ax² + bx + c
Where:
• a ≠ 0 (coefficient of x²)
• b is the coefficient of x
• c is the constant term

**Examples:**
• f(x) = x² (simplest quadratic)
• f(x) = 2x² - 3x + 1
• f(x) = -x² + 4x - 2

**Key Characteristic:** The highest power of x is 2, creating a U-shaped curve called a parabola.

sections.title: Parts of a Parabola
sections.content:
**Vertex:** The highest or lowest point of the parabola
• Maximum point if a < 0 (opens downward)
• Minimum point if a > 0 (opens upward)

**Axis of Symmetry:** Vertical line through the vertex
• Formula: x = -b/(2a)
• Parabola is symmetric about this line

**Y-intercept:** Where the parabola crosses the y-axis
• Always at point (0, c)

**X-intercepts (Roots):** Where the parabola crosses the x-axis
• Found by solving ax² + bx + c = 0

sections.title: Direction of Opening
sections.content:
**The coefficient 'a' determines direction:**

**When a > 0:**
• Parabola opens upward (∪)
• Has a minimum point (vertex)
• Example: f(x) = x² + 2x + 1

**When a < 0:**
• Parabola opens downward (∩)
• Has a maximum point (vertex)
• Example: f(x) = -x² + 4x - 1

**The larger |a|, the narrower the parabola**

sections.title: Real-World Applications in Ghana
sections.content:
**Projectile Motion:**
When a football is kicked at Cape Coast Stadium, its path follows a parabola. The height h after t seconds might be: h(t) = -5t² + 20t + 2

**Business Revenue:**
A kenkey seller finds that revenue R depends on price p: R(p) = -10p² + 100p. This helps find the optimal price for maximum revenue.

**Architecture:**
The arch of the Kwame Nkrumah Memorial follows a parabolic shape for structural strength and aesthetic beauty.

questions.question: For f(x) = -2x² + 4x - 1, which way does the parabola open?
questions.explanation: Since a = -2 < 0, the parabola opens downward and has a maximum point.

questions.question: What is the y-intercept of f(x) = 3x² - 2x + 5?
questions.explanation: The y-intercept occurs when x = 0, so f(0) = 5. The y-intercept is always the constant term c.

exercises.title: Quadratic Components
exercises.instructions: Identify the values of a, b, c and describe the parabola's characteristics.
exercises.hint: Remember: a affects direction and width, b affects the axis of symmetry, c is the y-intercept.

exercises.title: Sketching Parabolas
exercises.instructions: Graph quadratic functions by identifying key features before plotting points.
exercises.hint: Start with the vertex and y-intercept, then use symmetry to find more points.

scenarioChallenges.title: Ghana Sports Stadium Design
scenarioChallenges.scenario: Engineers are designing a new sports complex in Tamale. The roof structure follows a parabolic arch described by h(x) = -0.1x² + 4x, where x is the horizontal distance from one end and h is the height in meters.
tasks: Determine the maximum height of the arch
Find the width of the arch at ground level
Calculate the height at the center of the arch
Explain why this parabolic shape is structurally advantageous
learningObjectives: Apply quadratic functions to architectural problems
Find vertex and roots of parabolas
scenarioChallenges.ghanaContext: Ghana has been investing in modern sports infrastructure, with new stadiums and complexes being built across the country for various sporting events and community activities.
